meanings.definition: A person or group that produces cheap, low-quality goods or entertainment.
meanings.sent1: The schlockmeisters at the flea market sold poorly made toys.
meanings.sent2: The film was full of schlockmeisters who churned out B-movies.
meanings.sent3: The schlockmeisters tried to pass off their shoddy products as high-end goods.
meanings.sent4: The market was flooded with schlockmeisters peddling their inferior wares.
meanings.sent5: The town was known for its abundance of schlockmeisters producing subpar items.

meanings.definition: To produce or create something of low quality or value.
meanings.sent1: They schlockmeistered the merchandise to meet the demand for cheap goods.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to schlockmeister the product to cut costs.
meanings.sent3: He schlockmeistered the project, resulting in a poorly executed outcome.
meanings.sent4: The artist schlockmeistered the painting, disappointing art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: She schlockmeistered the design, leading to a lackluster final product.
